intro: Heterandra reniformis, commonly known as the broad-leafed heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its leathery, elliptic to ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, rounded clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Heterandra reniformis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
